member.summary: Auto Registration extends popular Unity IoC container and provides nice fluent syntax to configure rules for automatic types registration

member.summary: Auto Registration contract

member.name: M:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.AutoRegistration.If.ImplementsITypeName(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether type implements interface that name looks like ITypeName (first letter is I, the rest is implementing type name), for example this method returns true for type that looks like - class Logger : ILogger
member.returns: True if type implements ITypeName interface, otherwise false

member.name: M:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.AutoRegistration.If.ImplementsSingleInterface(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether type implements only one interface
member.returns: True if type implements single interface, otherwise false

member.name: M:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.AutoRegistration.If.Any(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true for any type that is not null
member.returns: Always returns true if type is not null

member.name: M:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.AutoRegistration.If.Is``1(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether type passed as method argument is equal to type passed as generic method parameter.
member.typeparam: Generic method parameter type
member.returns: true if generic method parameter type is equal to method argument type; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.AutoRegistration.If.IsAssignableFrom``1(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether type is assignable from specified type.

Allow us to create an entity in the context of the actual type being resolved.
Solution taken from http://unity.codeplex.com/discussions/203744

member.name: T:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.InitialisedExtension
member.summary: Simple marker extension to know that we have initialized a container.
member.remarks: Needed so that we don't invoke more than once which causes issues with resolving IServiceLocator.

member.summary: Registration interfaces and their associated implementations into a Unity container.

member.name: T:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.EnergyTradingUnityServiceLocator
member.summary:
An implementation of that wraps a Unity container.
Differs from the standard Microsoft implementation in that put ourselves into the container using , the original used a lifetime manager that held a weak reference which can lead to the ServiceLocator disappearing from the container!

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a container.
member.param: The to wrap with the interface implementation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a container.
member.param: The to wrap with the interface implementation.
Whether to use TryResolve or Resolve directly

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: When implemented by inheriting classes, this method will do the actual work of resolving the requested service instance.

member.name: T:EnergyTrading.Container.Unity.WebCallContextLifetimeManager
member.summary:
Contextual lifetime manager for use by ASP.NET.
Differs from CallContextLifetimeManager as we use HttpContext.Current to hold object references. This is required as ASP.NET can use multiple threads for a single request under heavy load and so CallContext is not adequate.

member.name: P:EnergyTrading.Registrars.MappingEngineRegistrar`1.CacheMappers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the mapping engines cache mappers.
member.remarks: For bulk operations, e.g. serializing 1K trades, the cost of resolving the mappers becomes appreciable so we provide this as a way of caching them in the mapping engine.
